With so many Napolists coming out of the woodwork , implicating  more and more senators and members of the House of Representatives , past and incumbent , people are no longer shocked at how pervasive corruption has become .
Once the people lose their faith in government , anarchy prevails .
It appers as though the country is staring at a political abyss !
Really , our leaders should never underestimate the Filipino .
While his patience and optimism are legendary , he can only take so much beating .
As a journalist for more than 60 years , both in print and broadcast , I have never seen corruption as pervasive as now .
Still , the involvement of some people close to the President now in the Cabinet level also implicates the Aquino administration to a great extent .

I have written about the emerging art market in Southeast Asia , specifically in Singapore , and also in and Hong Kong .
Last week , Art Basel in Hong Kong showed the world that from a cultural desert , the former Crown Colony has become an arts hub .

This kind of event was first held in Basel , Switzerland and Miami , Florida , and it took over HK , as it was , showcasing contemporary and modern art all over Southeast Asia , becoming a phenomenal success and a signature event in Asia .

The sad part of this is that there were only two booths showcasing Filipino contemporary and modern sculpture , paintings and photos .
The country is missing a lot of things with the emergence of Southeast Asian arts and culture .
